availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Gould Phillips (Marion County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Eusebia Burton Phillips in Boyle County, Kentucky, on April 13, 1863. Father of Emma Phillips. Resident of Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Clerk in Marion County in 1860. Merchant in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 343A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 617.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, District 1, p. 547.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 77A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994028, Boyle County Marriages, p. 185.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, KY, 1863, p. 386.
"Correspondence of the Louisville Journal," Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), April 9, 1864.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1891-1939) vol. 104: 1913, p. 218.
"James G. Phillips (1830-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial 113059711, accessed January 25, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113059711.
